intro: Tibouchina cymosa, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 meters. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, depending on the stage of bloom. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Tibouchina cymosa thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and moist forests.
